meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp pain or emotion.
meanings.sent1: After eating the ice cream too fast, she felt a twinge in her head.
meanings.sent2: He winced as a twinge shot through his leg.
meanings.sent3: The twinge of jealousy she felt was quickly replaced by admiration.
meanings.sent4: The twinge of regret lingered in his heart long after the mistake was made.
meanings.sent5: The sudden twinge of fear made her heart race.

meanings.definition: To feel a sudden, sharp pain or emotion.
meanings.sent1: She twinged with guilt when she realized her mistake.
meanings.sent2: He twinges every time he remembers the accident.
meanings.sent3: The comedian twinged with embarrassment when his joke fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Her heart twinged with longing as she watched the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the betrayal still twinges in his mind.
